reporter-output.line: Enter 'admin@publisher.nbcuni.com' in the 'Email Address' text box.
Enter 'Pub SSO' in the 'Filter Name' text box.
Switch to frame titled 'Some required modules must be enabled'.
Click the 'Continue' button to enable additional modules.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Click the 'SimpleSAMLphp Auth Settings' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'People dialog'.
Verify the 'Activate authentication via SimpleSAMLphp' check box is unchecked.
Verify the value of the 'Installation directory' text box equals '/mnt/www/html/nbcupublisher7qa5/simplesamlphp' and the text box is disabled.
Verify the value of the 'Authentication source for this SP' text box equals 'pub-qa5install' and the text box is disabled.
Verify the ' Force https for login links' check box is checked and disabled.
Verify the value of the 'Which attribute from simpleSAMLphp should be used as user's name' text box equals 'email' and the text box is disabled.
Verify the value of the 'Which attribute from simpleSAMLphp should be used as unique identifier for the user' text box equals 'uid' and the text box is disabled.
Verify the value of the 'Which attribute from simpleSAMLphp should be used as user mail address' text box equals 'email' and the text box is disabled.
Enter the file path for certificate upload.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Verify the text 'A certificate exists for this instance of SimpleSAMLphp.' is present on the page.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Click the 'Activate authentication via SimpleSAMLphp' check box.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Enter '206424392' in the 'SSO ID' text box.
Verify the text 'Modules' is NOT present on the page.
Verify the text 'Brandon.Clark@nbcuni.com' is present on the page.
Enter 'admin@publisher.nbcuni.com' in the 'Email Address' text box.
Click the 'Activate authentication via SimpleSAMLphp' check box.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Verify success message of 'SimpleSAMLphp authentication is NOT yet activated.' is present.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Modules dialog'.
Enter 'Pub SSO' in the 'Filter Name' text box.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Enter 'simpleSAMLphp authentication' in the 'Filter Name' text box.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
